channel.title: TestScape Drops

item.title: TestScape Drops
item.dc:creator: @srhiro srhiro
item.description:
@srhiro wrote:

Hello All,
I am having a problem with Drops in testscape. it says this:

// this is index number in autospawn cfg, not actual npc id, if using more than 1 of the desired npc use more than one index - cheez

under the npchandler.java, where the npcdrop codes are:

if(NPCID2 == 297 || NPCID2 == 298 || NPCID2 == 299 || NPCID2 == 300 || NPCID2 == 301 || NPCID2 == 302 || NPCID2 == 303 || NPCID2 == 304) 
{
ItemHandler.addItem(Item2.randomAbyssal(), npcs[NPCID].absX, npcs[NPCID].absY, 1, GetNpcKiller(NPCID), false);
}
if(NPCID2 == 360 || NPCID2 == 361 ||NPCID2 == 362 || NPCID2 == 363 || NPCID2 == 364 || NPCID2 == 365 || NPCID2 == 366)
{
ItemHandler.addItem(Item2.randomWknight(), npcs[NPCID].absX, npcs[NPCID].absY, 1, GetNpcKiller(NPCID), false);
}

Ext…

but I don’t understand how do I get the autospawn # of the Npc?
I thought it might had been the line # the npc is on so I went to autospawn and put in Ctrl+G and the # 360 but it wasnt a Woman.
and I notice it says NPCID2 not NPCID, so how do I get the npcid2?
I already tried changing teh “admin” to my name, in hopes of making the npcid2 appear in the runserver box when I attack a enemy but it dosen’t. And I made sure it wasnt commented so, don’t post those solutions.

If anyone could help me find the NPCID2 Id’s or maybe post a list of them that would be great.

Thanks. ;D

Read full topic
